reviews.review:
AHHH!!!  Stay away from this!  It eats your time and money, and that is about the best thing about it!
All I can say is I have kids, so I HAD to go to this.  My expectations were very, VERY low, and it was still painful to sit though.  I know you are supposed to suspend disbelief, but it is like the movie makers are CHALLENGING you to stretch your credibility as much as you can.  Geez  - they are making movies about glorified LETTERS.  Oh man.
On the up side, my kids seemed to enjoy it somewhat.  But even they watched it once, and haven't asked to see it again (usually they want to watch a movie over and over for whatever reason)
this shit was lit nigga rating 10/10

This is the greatest movie in existence. Thank you Sony Pictures, for this masterpiece. It's even better than The Bee Movie (which is a REALLY big call). I counted down the days till July 28th and had a huge party on the date.
I can definitely see why this was the worst movie of 2017. This was very stupid and ridiculous.

This might be one of the worst movies ever made. The first half hour alone will make your jaw drop in astonishment at what's actually happening/being explained, but other than that The Emoji movie is devoid of any heart, and paints a terrible message that is endangering to young and older generations.

The exact same anime movie we have seen time and again: character shunned for being different from the masses, then learns to embrace his uniqueness. 

Don't fool yourself. If you think this movie is bad, then realize almost ALL animated movies from the past 10 yrs are equally cliched and bad.
So many things wrong with this movie... Where do I start? The potty humor, or the strange bathroom conversation?

This animated flick is crazy cute!! BOTH my boys LOVE IT!! Matter of fact, most everyone we know who's watched it, digs the hell out of it!! So I'm quite surprised at the tomato rating!! Yeah, it's got some crude adult humor........BUT, these days..... so do MOST Disney & Pixar & DreamWorks animation movies.

I cannot believe it, but this movie was not actually bad. James Corden is insufferable and his role would have been better off with just about any actor in existence. That said, the concept is executed decently, and the bigger of an emoji user you are, the better it gets. Simply put, an enjoyable and quick watch.
